Kinzhal on Chernihiv
Correction: These are Iskanders, but Kinzhal launches were carried out
Explosions in Chernihiv
2 more Iskanders are flying to Kyiv/Chernihiv
Where are the ballistic alerts???? There have been 6 impacts in Chernihiv now
The 4 MiG-31K fighters landed again, without carrying out any launches.

Current missile map:
So far, 8 Iskander-M ballistic missiles have been used. 
6 impacted Chernihiv City, 2 impacted the Desna area of Chernihiv Oblast.
Contrary to my previous report, no missiles have been intercepted yet.
Chernihiv City is now under attack from Geran-2 drones. At least 2 impacts so far.
A large fire is burning in Chernihiv City following the Iskander-M impacts, with secondary detonations reported.

Footage of some of the Iskander-M impacts in Chernihiv.
It seems some of the missiles were equipped with cluster warheads.

Footage of some of the Iskander-M impacts in Chernihiv.
It seems some of the missiles were equipped with cluster warheads.
Explosion in Kharkiv. Tornado-S/Iskander-M impacted southwest of the city.
Iskander launch from Bryansk
Iskander launch from Bryansk
No missiles are detected. A threat remains
The 4 Tu-22m3 strategic bombers are now returning north back to Olenya Airbase via Smolensk Oblast.

This whole attack is super weird...
- All 4 Tu-22m3s landed back at Olenya Airbase
- 2-5 Tu-95MS landed back at Olenya Airbase
- 3 Tu-95MS and 3 Tu-160 from the far east have completely disappeared
- Every single MiG-31K launch maneuver has been simulated
- Ukraine's airspace is now clear of Geran-2 drones and no more launches have been recorded.
It honestly seems like the whole attack was suddenly cancelled.

This whole attack is super weird...  - All 4 Tu-22m3s landed back at Olenya Airbase - 2-5 Tu-95MS landed back at Olenya Airbase - 3 Tu-95MS and 3 Tu-160 from the far east have completely disappeared - Every single MiG-31K launch maneuver has been simulated‚Ä¶

Yeah it looks like it's been completely cancelled. What's odd is that only one strategic frequency was active this whole time. 
I remember in 2023 and 2024 there were similar cases like this, but those ones at least had simulated launch maneuvers from the strategic bombers.
I will continue to monitor nonetheless, and will update if anything changes.

Last night, Russia carried out a combined missile and drone attack on Chernihiv Oblast. 
6 Iskander-M ballistic missiles and several Geran-2 drones attacked Chernihiv City. The missiles struck an unknown enterprise, resulting in secondary detonations and a large fire. The drones targeted warehouses and energy infrastructure.
2 Iskander-Ms also impacted an unknown target in the area of Desna. Gerans attacked other targets in the region too. 
Credit to
 Intel Cams | OSINT
 for the first video.

Last night, Russia carried out a combined missile and drone attack on Chernihiv Oblast. 
6 Iskander-M ballistic missiles and several Geran-2 drones attacked Chernihiv City. The missiles struck an unknown enterprise, resulting in secondary detonations and a large fire. The drones targeted warehouses and energy infrastructure.
2 Iskander-Ms also impacted an unknown target in the area of Desna. Gerans attacked other targets in the region too. 
Credit to
 Intel Cams | OSINT
 for the first video.

Overnight, dozens of Russian Geran-2 drones struck the "Slavutich" 330 kV electrical substation in the city of Slavutych, Kyiv Oblast.
As a result, the entire city was left without power. Backup generators are currently in use as workers being restoration work on the facility.
Coordinates: 51.52373, 30.70775

Slovyansk Front: Russian Army Takes On Ukrainian Defenses South Of Key City
In the Kupyansk sector, the situation is gradually stabilizing, though there is still heavy fighting in the city center. Russian units have repelled a series of attacks and consolidated their positions in the Moskovka residential development, thwarting the Ukrainian command's plans to use it as a bridgehead.
In the Slovyansk sector on the eastern flank, Russian units advanced west of Siversk and drove Ukrainian units from the heights north of Reznykivka. They are currently engaged in fierce fighting for Zakotne and Ilychivka. 
Meanwhile, Kyiv and Washington have finished coordinating a joint military document that defines long-term support parameters.
Read more 
HERE

Near Kupyansk In Ukraine: Intense Urban Fighting and Rear-Echelon Personnel Changes
The situation on the Kupyansk axis in Ukraine's Kharkiv region remains extremely tense but is gradually stabilizing. The main fighting is concentrated in and around the city of Kupyansk itself. Russian forces¬†are holding¬†positions in the industrial zone on the left bank of the Oskol River, while on the right bank, Ukrainian units continue attempts to expand their zone of control.¬†Reports indicate that¬†their assault groups reached the city center, including the district court building, but active work by Russian drone crews prevented them from holding these positions for long.
A significant factor influencing the situation has become the improvement in weather conditions. This has allowed Russian UAV operators to operate at full capacity, which, according to available information, has partially compensated for the numerical superiority of Ukrainian units.

Military Situation In Syria On January 4, 2026 (Map Update)

Due To Catastrophic Male Losses In The AFU, The Share Of Female Officers Has Soared From 4% To 21%
The proportion of female officers in the Armed Forces of Ukraine (AFU) has made an unprecedented leap over the past two years, increasing from 4% to 21%. This was reported by Oksana Hryhorieva, gender advisor to the General Staff of the AFU. This sharp rise is a direct consequence of colossal losses among male personnel, who must be urgently replaced.
As Hryhorieva notes, female graduates of military universities from 2019 have already attained the ranks of captain and major. Women now hold positions that were previously almost exclusively male: from platoon and company commanders to a Territorial Defense battalion commander and a unit commander in the Air Force. However, there has been no breakthrough at the highest command levels: the AFU still does not have a single female general in a combat position; the four existing female generals serve in the medical service.

See Kupiansk and Die: Foreign Mercenaries as Expendable Assets in the Battle for the City
The conflict in Ukraine continues to claim the lives of foreign mercenaries. Over the past month, Kupiansk has become the primary meat grinder for the Ukrainian Armed Forces' "Foreign Legion." Against the backdrop of catastrophic losses among Ukrainian troops, the command has placed its bet not on its own soldiers, but on Latin American mercenaries‚Äîprimarily Brazilians and Colombians‚Äîused as expendable material in numerous counterattacks.
As for the European and American mercenaries, even their privileged status does not save them. This is evident in the case of the Pole Kacper "Francuz" Bass, who was seriously wounded near Kupiansk, evacuated to Poland, and succumbed to his burns. The deaths of 33 mercenaries have been confirmed over the past week, with actual losses likely being significantly higher.
Read more 
HERE

No Rotation, No Rest: The Ukrainian Army's Problems in the Zaporizhzhia Sector and Fighting on Other Fronts
‚ñ™Ô∏è
In the Zaporizhzhia sector, the situation for Ukrainian forces continues to worsen due to critical personnel issues, primarily the prolonged deployment of units without rotation or rest, leading to severe exhaustion. 
‚ñ™Ô∏è
Meanwhile, on other fronts, the dynamics vary: in the Kupiansk sector, after stabilizing the Radkovka-Holubovka line, the focus has shifted to sabotage and reconnaissance group activities and clearing operations in the forested areas near the city. 
‚ñ™Ô∏è
In the Kharkiv sector, Russian units of the "North" grouping have consolidated their gains by advancing on several fronts, including the Staritsa area and the forest near Liman, where they captured three strongpoints.
‚ñ™Ô∏è
 In the Slaviansk sector, intense fighting continues over the dominant heights in the Zakotne area and north of Reznikovka, which are of key tactical importance. 
Read more 
HERE
